verses.verse: And Jacob<WH3290> lifted up<WH5375> his eyes<WH5869>, and looked<WH7200>, and<WH6215>, behold, Esau came<WH935>, and with him four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376>. And he divided<WH2673> the sons<WH3206> unto Leah<WH3812>, and unto Rachel<WH7354>, and unto the two<WH8147> handmaids<WH8198>.
And he put<WH7760> the handmaids<WH8198> and their sons<WH3206> foremost<WH7223>, and Leah<WH3812> and her sons<WH3206> after<WH314>, and Rachel<WH7354> and Joseph<WH3130> last<WH314>.
And he passed over<WH5674> before them<WH6440>, and bowed himself<WH7812> to the ground<WH776> seven<WH7651> times<WH6471>, until he came near<WH5066> to his brother<WH251>.
And Esau<WH6215> ran<WH7323> to meet him<WH7125>, and embraced<WH2263> him<WH5307>, and fell on his neck<WH6677>, and kissed him<WH5401>: and they wept<WH1058>.

And he lifted up<WH5375> his eyes<WH5869>, and saw<WH7200> the women<WH802> and the sons<WH3206>; and said<WH559>, Who are those<WH428> with you And he said<WH559>, The sons<WH3206> which God<WH430> has graciously given<WH2603> your servant<WH5650>.
Then the handmaids<WH8198> came near<WH5066>, they and their sons<WH3206>, and they bowed themselves<WH7812>.

And Leah<WH3812> also with her sons<WH3206> came near<WH5066>, and bowed themselves<WH7812>: and after<WH310> came<WH5066> Joseph<WH3130> near<WH5066> and Rachel<WH7354>, and they bowed themselves<WH7812>.
And he said<WH559>, What mean you by all this company<WH4264> which I met<WH6298>? And he said<WH559>, These are to find<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of my lord<WH113>.
And Esau<WH6215> said<WH559>, I have<WH3426> enough<WH7227>, my brother<WH251>; keep that you have unto yourself.

And Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559>, No I pray you if now I have found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in your sight<WH5869>, then receive<WH3947> my present<WH4503> at my hand<WH3027>: for therefore I have seen<WH7200> your face<WH6440>, as though I had seen<WH7200> the face<WH6440> of God<WH430>, and you were pleased with me<WH7521>.

Take<WH3947>, I pray you my blessing<WH1293> that is brought<WH935> to you because God<WH430> has dealt graciously with me<WH2603>, and because<WH3605> I have<WH3426> enough<WH3605>. And he urged<WH6484> him<WH3947>, and he took it.
And he said<WH559>, Let us take our journey<WH5265>, and let us go<WH3212>, and I will go before you<WH3212>

And he said<WH559> unto him<WH113>, My lord knows<WH3045> that the sons<WH3206> are tender<WH7390>, and the flocks<WH6629> and herds<WH1241> with young<WH5763> are with me<WH1849>: and if men should overdrive them one<WH259> day<WH3117>, all the flock<WH6629> will die<WH4191>.

Let my lord<WH113>, I pray you pass over<WH5674> before<WH6440> his servant<WH5650>: and I will lead on<WH5095> softly<WH328>, according as<WH7272> the cattle<WH4399> that goes before me<WH6440> and the sons<WH3206> be able to endure<WH7272>, until I come<WH935> unto my lord<WH113> unto Seir<WH8165>.

And Esau<WH6215> said<WH559>, Let me now leave<WH3322> with you some of the folk<WH5971> that are with me<WH559>. And he said, What<WH4100> needs it<WH4672>? Let me find grace<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of my lord<WH113>.
So Esau<WH6215> returned<WH7725> that day<WH3117> on his way<WH1870> unto Seir<WH8165>.

And Jacob<WH3290> journeyed<WH5265> to Succoth<WH5523>, and built<WH1129> him a house<WH1004>, and made<WH6213> shelters<WH5521> for his cattle<WH4735>: therefore the name<WH8034> of the place<WH4725> is called<WH7121> Succoth<WH5523>.

And Jacob<WH3290> came<WH935> to Shalem<WH8004>, a city<WH5892> of Shechem<WH7927>, which is in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>, when he came<WH935> from Padan<WH6307>–aram; and pitched his tent<WH2583> before<WH6440> the city<WH5892>.

And he bought<WH7069> a parcel<WH2513> of a field<WH7704>, where he had spread<WH5186> his tent<WH168>, at the hand<WH3027> of the sons<WH1121> of Hamor<WH2544>, Shechem<WH7927>'s father<WH1>, for a hundred<WH3967> pieces of money<WH7192>.
And he erected<WH5324> there a altar<WH4196>, and called it<WH7121> El<WH415>–elohe–Israel.
